messages.text: :slightly_smiling_face:

Alright, let's go with #1898 then. I still think debouncing is better than cancelling when we don't care about the result (because what we have implemented as "cancelling" doesn't actually cancel anything, it just ignores the result).

elements.text: Alright, let's go with #1898 then. I still think debouncing is better than cancelling when we don't care about the result (because what we have implemented as "cancelling" doesn't actually cancel anything, it just ignores the result).

messages.text: I read a bit more, and I think what we really want is the `RateLimiter` in <https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/22318#issuecomment-316497469>, in combination with the cancellation token story. That is essentially the combination of debouncing _and_ cancellation.

messages.text: So main question right now is: do we push 1.1.14 out to the release channel and continue fixing things in patch releases that we then release quickly, or do we think the errors we have right now should reset our RC sequence, we push a 1.1.15 out to the insider channel and then hope to release that in a few days?

elements.text: So main question right now is: do we push 1.1.14 out to the release channel and continue fixing things in patch releases that we then release quickly, or do we think the errors we have right now should reset our RC sequence, we push a 1.1.15 out to the insider channel and then hope to release that in a few days?

messages.text: I think the main consideration should be whether we think that 1.1.14 is better than the currently shipping version.

elements.text: I think the main consideration should be whether we think that 1.1.14 is better than the currently shipping version.

messages.text: Looking at the crash reporting for 1.0.10, I'm getting the sense that 1.1.14 has fewer crashes than that, even with the still existing string parsing problem.

elements.text: Looking at the crash reporting for 1.0.10, I'm getting the sense that 1.1.14 has fewer crashes than that, even with the still existing string parsing problem.

messages.text: So my vote would be that I release 1.1.14 to the release channel now. And that we then do a fairly quick sequence of patch releases that fix remaining issues and any issues that come up from crash reporting as we move forward.

elements.text: So my vote would be that I release 1.1.14 to the release channel now. And that we then do a fairly quick sequence of patch releases that fix remaining issues and any issues that come up from crash reporting as we move forward.

messages.text: So I would also say that we keep all `master` branches blocked for feature merges for now, and say we do another week or so of patch/bug fix releases.

messages.text: So in my Manifest.toml there is `Missings` 0.4.5 listed, but there is no cache file for that on my system.
